name: String length
title: String length in Python
description: Returns the number of characters in a string using the built-in len() function.

syntax.parameters: s: a string (or other sequence) whose length you want to know.
syntax.returns: int: number of characters in the string.

code_examples.title: Basic len usage
code_examples.code:
message = "Hello World"
length = len(message)
print("Message length:", length)
code_examples.explanation: len() returns the total number of characters, including spaces.

code_examples.title: Check empty string
code_examples.explanation: Use len(s) == 0 to test for an empty string.

code_examples.title: Loop over characters
code_examples.code:
text = "Python"
for i in range(len(text)):
    ch = text[i]
    print(ch)
code_examples.explanation: Use len() with range() to loop using indices.

usage_notes: len() is a built-in function; you pass the string as an argument.
len() also works on lists, tuples, dicts, and other collections.
len(s) counts all characters in the string, including spaces.

gotchas.explanation: len is a built-in function, not a string method.
len(s) always returns an integer, never None.
